intro: Stilbe gymnopharyngia, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Stilbe gymnopharyngia is also noted for its ability to thrive in cooler climates and its resistance to pests and diseases.
